RUS1120 - Elementary Russian Language an.name: RUS1120 - Elementary Russian Language and Civilization I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces the student to Russian culture through the major language skills: listening, speaking, reading and writing. Open only to students with no experience in this language.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of skills in conversation and comprehension through practice.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

RUS2200 - Intermediate Russian Language.name: RUS2200 - Intermediate Russian Language and Civilization I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of language skills and cultural knowledge at the intermediate level.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Vocabulary building with systematic training in diction and locution. Speeches and oral presentations as well as production and delivery of real-life dialogues.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

RUS2201 - Intermediate Russian Language.name: RUS2201 - Intermediate Russian Language and Civilization II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of RUS 2200, with emphasis on Russian civilization.

Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures
